Re ''On Abortion, Hollywood Is No-Choice (June 10) by Mireya Navarro:
Interested producers, and viewers, would do well to rent and watch ''The Best of Everything,'' the 1959 movie starring Hope Lange, Joan Crawford, Stephen Boyd, Suzy Parker and others.

The additional-features commentary on my DVD by Rona Jaffe, the author of the original novel, and the film historian Sylvia Stoddard is a disturbing reminder that the more things change, the more they remain the same.

Just as in the movies you cite almost a half-century later, the woman who is impregnated by a cad decides to keep the baby. But she miscarries after an accident, and winds up with the emergency room doctor to boot.
